note.p: Career: Went to Calcutta as a writer in the service of the HEIC (1750); British Resident, Murshidabad (1758-1761); Governor of Bengal and President of the Council (1772); Governor General (1773); resigned and returned to England (1784); impeached and tried (1788-1795) and acquitted (1795)
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 1. 1731-1847' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 307-332
